intro: Montanoa laskowskii, commonly known as the Laskowski's montanoa, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
